稼ぐに追いつく貧乏無し

Poverty leaves no leisure―A poor man has no time to spare.
Poor people are prolific―“Children are the poor man's riches.”
“A Jack of all trades is master of none”―Versatility never pays.

He was not at home to me―He was denied to me.
彼は不在とばかりで誰にも会わない
He is not at home to any one―denied to all callers.
この前伺った時はご不在でした
The last time I called on you, I found you out.
I am sorry I missed your call.
家人の不在に乗じて賊が忍び込んだ
Taking advantage of the inmates' absence, a burglar broke into the house.
(不在の時に重きをおけば)while one is absent―during his absence―(不在なることに重きをおけば)―when one is absent―in one's absence
不在中誰か来なかったか
Did any one call while I was out?―during my absence?
それは不在中の出来事で詳しいことは存じません
It happened when I was absent―in my absence―and I do not know the particulars.
ご不在中の出来事はことごとくお知らせ申します
I will inform you of whatever happens in your absence.
ご不在中は誰か代理をしますか
Who will take your place during your absence?
不在中学校を預かってくれる人があると好い
I want a man to take charge of my school during my absence.
校長の不在中私が学校を預かっております
I have charge of the school during the absence of the principal.

content:

〈自動〉
1. (=穴の口がふさがる)to close; to be closed; to be filled up; to be stopped up; to be blocked up; to be obstructed; to be choked; to be clogged; to clog; to foul

content.content: A hole is closed―A hole is stopped (up).
The hole is filled up―The gap is filled up.
路が馬車でふさがっている
The way is blocked up with carriages―obstructed by carriages.
悲しくて胸がいっぱいにふさがる
One's heart swells with grief―One is choked with grief―One is choked with emotions―One feels a lump in one's throat.
あいた口がふさがらぬ
One is in open-mouthed wonder―One gapes and stares.

content: 2. (=室や席がふさがる)to be occupied

content.content: 座敷がふさがっている
この部屋もじきに塞がる

この家はふさがっていますか
便所がふさがっている
地位が皆塞がっている

My time is taken up with teaching and writing―What with teaching, what with writing, my time is wholly taken up.

果物では腹がふさがらぬ
Fruit does not fill a hungry man.
日本料理は腹がふさがらぬと西洋人が言う

何か腹のふさがる物が欲しい

1. (=穴や口をふさぐ)to close (an opening); to stop (a hole); to fill up (a hole); to choke (a pipe); to stop up (a pipe); to bar (the way); to block (the path); to obstruct (the passage, etc.)

content.content: to close a hole―stop a hole
to fill up a hole―(欠陥なら)―stop a gap―make up a deficit―supply a deficiency
to bar the way―block (up) the path―obstruct the passage

content.content: No jesting with me!―No trifling with me!

ふざけた真似をしやがると承知しないぞ
None of your tomfooleries, or you will have to reckon with me.
俺を殺す気か、ふざけた真似をしあがるない
Do you seek my life? None of your tomfooleries!
ふざけたことを言うな

“Let not the grass grow on the path of friendship.”
近頃動物園にご無沙汰した
ご無沙汰の罪をゆるせ
Excuse me for being such a bad correspondent―Do not be offended at my long silence.
The neglect is on both sides.

It is unbecoming in a young man―It does not become a young man―to find fault with his elders.

He kept silence, as became a young man.

content:
ぶし〔武士〕
〈名〉A samurai; a knight; a warrior:(総称すれば)Japan's chivalry

content.content: The samurai is among men what the cherry is among flowers―The cherry among flowers, the samurai among men.
武士は食わねど高楊枝
The samurai glories in honourable poverty.
武士は生命よりも名を尚ぶ
The samurai values honour above life.
武士は死すとも恥をかかぬ
The samurai would rather die than live in dishonour―The samurai prefers death to dishonour―The samurai chooses death before dishonour.
武士の生命は義によって軽し
The samurai holds his live light, as compared with his cause.
The samurai should feel for each other.
Upon a samurai's word of honour, I will do it.
His conduct is worthy of a samurai.
さすがは武士だけあって子の死にも泣かぬ
Like the samurai that he was, he did not weep over the death of his child.
さすがの武士も泣いた
Samurai as he was, he cried at the touching sight.
Is this the conduct of a samurai?―Does he still call himself a samurai?
そんなことをしては武士の名折れだ
Such conduct is a blot on a samurai's escutcheon.
武士の面汚{つらよご}し、武士の風上にも置けぬ奴だ
He is a disgrace to Japan's chivalry.
武士の面目、武士の意地
そんなことをしては武士の面目が立たぬ
Such conduct would concern a samurai's honour―I should disgrace myself by doing such a thing.
The sword is the soul of a samurai.
the self-discipline and necessary accomplishments of a samurai
A samurai in business (is a certain failure).
武士の鞘当て挨拶さっしゃい
A samurai should apologize for this breach of etiquette.
君の馬前に死するは武士の本領
It is the duty of the samurai to die in battle for his liege lord.

content:
ぶじ〔無事〕
〈名〉
1. (=事無きこと)safety; escape; peace; good health

content.content: (災難のありし時)人の無事を祝す
to congratulate one on one's safety―wish one joy of one's escape
We congratulated each other on our safety.
I with you joy of your escape.

content: 2. (=無聊)inaction; want of occupation; ennui; tedium

content.content: 彼は無事に苦しんでいる
He is oppressed with ennui―oppressed with tedium―fretting and fuming in inaction―He does not know what to do with himself―He does not know how to dispose of his time―Time hangs heavy on his hands.
人は無事に苦しむと酒やばくちを始める
When a man has nothing to do, he will take to drinking and gambling.

content: 〈形〉(=変わりが無い)well; safe; safe and sound; quiet; whole; intact; all right:(=に) well; safely; in safety; quietly; without mishap; without mischance; without accident; without a hitch; in good condition; in good order

content.content: All (is) right―Nothing is wrong―Nothing has gone amiss―Nothing is the matter.
ありがとう、皆無事です
Thank you, we are quite well―safe and sound.
皆無事に暮らしております
We are getting along all right.
事は無事に運んでいる
He has arrived in safety―(物品なら)―It has arrived in good condition―arrived in good order.
I wish he would return in safety―come back whole.
これはお帰りなさい、まずご無事でおめでとう
Welcome home! I am glad to see you safe home again.
救命艇は無事に着いた
The life-boat come safe to land.
河へ飛び込んで子どもを無事に救い上げた
I plunged into the river, and brought the child safe to land.
飛行機は無事に着陸した
to pass off well―go off well
The ceremony has gone off very well―gone off without a hitch.
運動会も無事にすんだ
The field-day has passed off very well―gone off without mishap―gone off without a hitch―gone off without any accident.
二百十日も無事にすんだ
The critical day has passed quietly.
to come right―come round―come to nothing
結局無事に治まるだろう
Things will come round in the end.
事件は無事に治まった
The affair has come to nothing―Nothing has come of the affair.
この事件は無事に治まりそうもない
Something must come of the affair.
(鉄道椿事で)無事に免れた者は少ない
Few escaped injury―escaped without injury―escaped without any accident―got off with a whole skin.
僕だけは無事に免れた
I escaped skin-whole―got off without a scratch―came off unscathed.
(火事で)金庫は無事に残った
There is no harm in it―There is no danger in it―It is quite safe.
(酒を飲まずに)茶を飲んでいりゃ無事で好い
There is no harm in tea.
冒険をせずに堅くやっていれば無事で好い
Run no risks, but keep steady, and there is no danger.
一人の女房を守っていりゃ無事で好い
Stick to your wife―that is the safest way.

content:
ふしぎ〔不思議〕
〈名〉(A) wonder; (a) marvel; (a) mystery; a prodigy; a miracle:(=な) wonderful; marvellous; prodigious; miraculous; magical; mysterious; unaccountable; strange; odd

content.content: 天地は不思議なものだ
草の葉一枚でも不思議でないものは無い
Not a blade of grass but is mysterious.
彼の来ないのは不思議だ
His absence is mysterious―unaccountable―I can not account for his absence.
彼の成功したのは不思議だ
It is strange that he should have succeeded.
彼はどうして成功したか不思議だ
It is a wonder how he could have succeeded.
彼はどうして生きているか不思議だ
How he manages to live, is a mystery to me―a marvel to me.
あの勉強家の成功したのは何も不思議は無い
It is no wonder that such a hard-working man should have succeeded.
君がこんなことを知らないとは不思議だ
It is odd that you should not know it.
あのような女があんな男の妻になっているのは、はてさて不思議だと思った
It struck me as strange that such a woman should have married such a man.
彼のしたことを皆不思議に思った
彼は不思議に助かった
He has escaped by a miracle―He has had a miraculous escape.
彼が助かったのは実に不思議だ
His escape is little short of a miracle―His escape borders on the miraculous.
この薬は不思議に利く
This medicine does wonders―works wonders―works like magic.
不思議なことには少しもけがをしない
For a wonder,―Wonderful to tell,―Strange to say,―Curious to relate,―Oddly enough,―he was not hurt at all.
不思議なことがあればあるものだ
It is prodigious―miraculous―nothing short of a miracle―Wonders will never cease.
不思議な物もあればあるものだ、これは一体何だ
What, in the name of all that's wonderful, is this?
あら不思議やな、不思議なるかな
はて不思議だ、この銃の不発は無いことだ
Strange! I never knew this gun miss fire.
the seven wonders of the world

content.content: 俺が生きているうちはお前達に不自由はさせぬ

彼は小遣にも不自由している
つまらぬ物でも無いと不自由だ

content.content: The evidence is insufficient―The evidence is inconclusive.

content:
ふで〔筆〕
〈名〉
1. (=日本の筆)A writing-brush; a hair-pencil

content.content: to dip one's brush in ink

content: 2. (=文筆の筆)the pen

content.content: to give up the sword for the pen
to wield a pen―exert one's calligraphical powers
to lay down one's pen―close (a letter or a chapter)
He writes well―He is a good writer―He wields a facile pen.
to write whatever drops from one's pen
It was a slip of the pen.
“A good marksman may miss”―“It is a wise man who never blunders”―“Even Homer nods sometimes.”
“The cunning workman does not quarrel with his tool.”
to live by the pen―write for a living
to prostitute one's pen―pervert the truth―falsify the facts―misrepresent the state of things
筆の先で帳尻をごまかす
He wields a facile pen―He is a facile writer―a ready writer.
筆には剣に勝る力あり
“The pen is mightier than the sword.”

content: 3. (=ひと筆の筆)a stroke, a touch (of the pen or brush)

content.content: to write with a stroke of the pen
to dash off a sketch with three strokes of the brush
Just a line to let you know that...
筆ふとぶとと書いてある
It is written in a bold hand.
to add a few touches―touch it up―make corrections―revise a work
先生が筆を入れて下すった
My teacher touched it up for me―revised the work.
to dabble with the text―garble the text

content: 4. (=誰の作)a work, a production (of one's brush)

content.content: これは雪舟の筆だという
This is said to be a (work of) Sesshu―ascribed to the brush of Sesshu.
これは大家の筆になる画だ
This is a painting by a master hand.

content: 5. (=着想に対する作成)the execution

content.content: 彼は着想は好いが筆が立たぬ
His execution does not correspond with his conception―His ideas are all right, but his style leaves something to be desired.
